name: Everything 80s Part 2 Online Quiz | Entertainment by Decade | 10 Questions

questions.text: Which of the following sitcoms from the 80s was President Ronald Reagan's favorite?
questions.explanation:
Family Ties.

	Family Ties ran on NBC from 1982-1989.

questions.text: O.J. Simpson was considered for the lead role in which 1984 science fiction film?
questions.explanation:
The Terminator.

	James Cameron and team made the right choice here by giving the role to Arnold Schwarzenegger.  As of October 2002 he is working on "Terminator 3:  Rise of the Machines" due out sometime in 2003.

questions.text: Which cast member from "The Dukes of Hazzard" was elected to Congress in the 1980s?
questions.explanation:
Ben Jones.

	Ben Jones played Cooter the mechanic who always worked on the General Lee.  He ran for and won congressman for Georgia's 4th district from 1989-1993.  He also ran against and lost to Newt Gingrich in 1996 in Georgia's 6th district.  As of October 2002 he is running for a position in congress in Virginia's 7th district.

questions.text: What was the name of the sitcom that starred Soleil Moon Frye on NBC from 1984-1986?
questions.explanation:
Punky Brewster.

	Punky was a little girl who was abandoned by her mother in a grocery store and is eventually taken in and adopted by an older man played by George Gaines.

questions.text: John Hinckley Jr. attempted to assassinate President Ronald Reagan in March of 1981.  Which famous actress was he obsessed with?
questions.explanation:
Jodie Foster.

	Jodie Foster will still not even talk about this subject in any interviews.

questions.text: Which cable children's show did Alanis Morisette appear on in the early 80s?
questions.correct: U Can't Do That On Television
questions.explanation:
U Can't Do That On Television.

	Do you remember the green slime that would get dumped on you when you said "I don't know"?  Yuck!

questions.text: Which actress got her start in films such as "Lucas", "Beetlejuice", and "Heathers"?
questions.explanation:
Winona Ryder.

	Winona's real last name is Horowitz; she changed her name to Ryder because it sounded better for showbiz.

questions.text: Pepsi pulled out of a $5 million deal with Madonna in 1989 because of which racy video?
questions.explanation:
Like A Prayer.

	The video was deemed sacrilegious by many, which Pepsi felt was damaging to their product.  Madonna was allowed to keep the $5 Million retainer fee.

questions.text: Jane Wyman was a member of which popular prime time television series in the 1980s?
questions.explanation:
Falcon Crest.

	Jane Wyman was the first wife of former President Reagan.  She played Angela Channing on this long running drama from 1981-1990.

questions.text: What was the name of Kathleen Turner's character in "Romancing the Stone"?
questions.explanation:
Joan Wilder.

	This successful movie from 1984 co-starred Michael Douglas.  They would re-team in 1985 for the sequel "The Jewel of the Nile".
